of wean yourself off of the idea that

tip I give in my book is simply uh one
of those hours that you were going to
watch uh CSI with a body dredged out of
the swamp or Law and Order with the girl
dragged off the street turn off the TV
and spend that hour outside you know
walking around your neighborhood
preferably with your kid um to remind
yourself that you live in the
neighborhood okay that's where you live
you don't live in law and orderville and

started a correspondence with some guy

Brooklyn neighborhood where they're

ironic because he loves his neighborhood
cuz it's nice and quiet and safe but if
you ever saw it on Law and Order you'd
think that there's a murder every week
so remind yourself about the real world
and also it's safer you the more people
you meet the more neighbors you know the
more familiar you and your kid are to
the neighborhood everybody's safer and
connected a lot of the Freer range
message is about creating the community
we think was lost well it's lost if you
don't go out there but if you do go out
there you can connect again and that's
why one of the sort of offbeat ideas I
also give uh tip number three is when
you're place with a bunch of parents
each of them hovering over their own
child you know School the school gate
hasn't opened yet or soccer practice is
about to start in maybe five minutes or
you're at the bus stop because a lot of
parents now Drive their children to the
bus stop and wait for the bus to come
because they're so afraid of what might
happen um in that five minutes um when
you're with a lot of
parents turn to them and say you know
what I'll watch them I'll watch your
kids it's this mindblowing idea because
what you're saying is two things at once
one is we don't all need to be here you
know we don't think that wild banshees
are coming you know there's not a
twister you know in the distance that
we're all going to have to save our kids
from I think one adult can can watch
over all these children and they'll be
okay and what you're also saying is I
don't think it's a horrible burden for
me to watch your kids right I mean so
many times one of the things that we're
worried about is like don't want to
impose on anyone if I'm at the park I
don't want to ask another lady to watch
my kids while I go to the car and get
the the sippy cups because that's too
much it's not too much it's good to ask
favors of each other and to offer favors
so you offer the favor and then if no
parent takes you up on it you say okay
well listen Mary is staying here and I'm
going off to work and then you say I
know she'll be safe with you guys so
either way you are almost aggressively
saying I trust you I trust this
neighborhood I trust my child not to run
into into the street and when you start
reminding people that this is not um
that this is what people used to do I
think they used to watch out for each
other I think a lot of other countries
people still do this maybe we can renit
